metadata.title: CVE-2021-3347 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.10.11. PI futexeshave a kernel stack use-after-free during fault handling, allowing localusers to execute code in the kernel, aka CID-34b1a1ce1458.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1091-kvm - 4.4.0-1091.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-aws - 4.4.0-1126.140
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1098-aws - 4.15.0-1098.105~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1112-azure - 4.15.0-1112.124~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1097-gcp - 4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1069-oracle - 4.15.0-1069.77~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-208.240').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-142.146~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.100').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.140').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.105~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.124~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1069.77~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
